page.title: 15THE ISIS FISH FARM
page.content:
The fish farm is on the Evenlode at the site of the old Eynsham water mill at GR 438108. The mill has been converted into a luxurious dwelling house, and the river has been diverted through special concrete tanks.
The fish grown here are all rainbow trout which is a good but cheaper substitute for salmon. The farm handles about 1 million fish a year. The fish are bought in at 3 oz and kept in small round ponds with 11,000 fish in each. When they have grown to 12 oz they are put into larger pools, and are again graded by size. They are carefully fed with pellets of herring meal, with bigger pellets for bigger fish. The farm uses 50 tons of fish food each year. They lose a lot of fish which jump out or are caught by heron.
